definition: hearse
quick/alert/efficacious/effective/to come true/spirit/departed soul/coffin
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
surname Che
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: A hearse, repurposed as a taxi, happened to drive by.
sentences.chinese: 一輛改裝爲出租車的靈車碰巧駛過。

sentences.english: They don't see the hearse anymore.
At what time will the hearse come for the coffin to-morrow?
sentences.chinese: 靈車在明天幾點鐘來取棺材？

sentences.english: And blights with plague the Marriage hearse.
sentences.chinese: 更帶來瘟疫，將靈車頂替了婚牀。

sentences.english: The hearse will drive directly up to the grave.
sentences.chinese: 靈車要一直滾到墳坑邊。
